name: Hotel Century Southern Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed by staff excellent services
reviews.title: We Are Going Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Meals were fantastic loved the bar overlooking the city and we saw Mt Fuji at dusk
reviews.title: Oasis in the middle of the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recomend highly
reviews.title: Great hotel, in a great location
Century Southern Tower in Tokyo
reviews.text: Cannot wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: we put a do not disturb on our room and they freaked out as they could not clean the rooms left two messages on our phone to ask when they can clean it
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for our trip

likes.disliked: — Bar doesn't stay open very late

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Century Southern Hotel
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great location, rooms still good but start thinking renovation
Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: I've been to Tokyo 4 times for business and/or leisure and all 4 times I've stayed at this hotel for at least 1 day. This hotel is a fantastic hotel with fantastic service located in the heart of Shinjuku. The hotel is minutes walk from Shinjuku train station; and the views from the 20th floor lobby is absolutely breath taking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2004
reviews.text: To get to this hotel from Narita airport - take the Narita Express (do not take a taxi - a taxi will take almost 2 hrs and will cost close to $300 USD) to Shinjuku station. The Narita Express costs about $31 USD/person one way and is fast and efficient. It'll take about 1hr 25 minutes. Get off at Shinjuku station, get out at the Southern Terrace exit or South Main Exit. Look up and head for the tall white building - past the Starbucks and directly adjacent to the relatively new Krispy Kreme store. Take the elevator to the 20th floor lobby.
reviews.title: Wow Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I loved my time at Hotel Century Southern Tower. Being my first time in Tokyo it was a little tricky to find, but I found a helpful Japanese uniformed man who showed me the general direction to take.
reviews.title: A Great Experience

likes.liked: — Free internet, air conditioning, the stunning views, the cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Narita Express from Narita International Airport in Tokyo costs around US$30 and takes precisely 77 minutes to Shinjuku station (via Tokyo station). My tip: find the Southern exit (I mistakenly took the South-East exit the first time). Beside the Southern exit of Shinjuku station is a pedestrian crossing - cross it, do a dog-leg to the right and keep heading South (basically, keep heading straight as you exit the Southern exit of Shinjuku station). After crossing the road is a walkway, and as you keep walking you may notice signs to the hotel.. or if you miss those you certainly won't miss seeing queues of people at a Krispy Kreme donut shop (it's all the rage, queues are there at all hours of the day and well into the night). After about a 5 minute walk the hotel is on the right.. and then find the elevators to the 20th floor to the hotel lobby to check in.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in staff are friendly. I didn't attempt to exercise a great deal of English, but was able to communicate the uncomfortable situation of having my credit card declined (I went around the corner to the pay phones, bought a phone card, and called Australia to get my credit card unfrozen). All-in-all a painless check-in experience.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My room was clean, tidy. Free broadband Ethernet - I didn't have a cable but a 7-story electronics store called BIC Camera was nearby and I bought an Ethernet cable there. The free internet was great. There's no wireless connectivity, however (not a problem for me).
reviews.title: Good value and base for action

likes.disliked: — small rooms; lack of room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had some trouble trying to figure out how to turn off the entrance light, but it turned out that pretty much all lights could be controlled by a control panel on the bedside table.
reviews.title: what can I say!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I recently spent stayed at the Century Southern (June 14-18). I concur on the others comments about the great location and value. What I was most impressed with was their service. We had checked out and left our bags at storage since we were transferring to stay near Tokyo Disneyland later in the day. When we came back, my sister in law starting feeling nauseous to the point where she couldn't walk. We intially asked a staff person if we could use a room. She responded that we had to pay. In her defense, I don't believe she had to authority to allow us to use a room. Shortly thereafter, a manager noticed the situation and offered a room for us to use. We stayed there for a couple of hours until we realized that we had to stay there for the night. Fortunately, there were available rooms and the manager charged us a great rate. In addition, a couple of days later when we were checking out, the hotel allowed us to check out late (3 pm) because of the situation. I would definitely stay again and recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Went Beyond the Call

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just want to add another review written by another satisfied customer! We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Century Southern Tower in Shinjuku and everything certainly lived up to our expectations. Since our main purpose of the trip was to shop (and eat), so location was our priority. For 14500 JPY a night (booked from a Japanese site), the hotel offered us a stunning view of Tokyo skyline and most importantly, a bigger-than-average room with plenty of space to walk around. Trust me, other hotels we found upon googling offer 15-18 sqm rooms for pretty much what we paid at Hotel Century ,, and 15 sqm is a joke ,, so why book elsewhere? The simmons bed was generally comfy and other amenities were spot on.
reviews.title: Delighted with my stay at Hotel Century

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Big plus for Hotel Century is, if you decide to use the Narita Express train, this would be a perfect base for your Shinjuku trip. From the Southern Terrace exit, walk up 10 easy steps and turn left. The entrance of the hotel can be reached in another 1-2 minutes on your right (pass Starbucks and Krispie Kreme), making life less troublesome for those with lots to carry.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel with excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Check-in and out were swiftly done and the convenient store next to the lifts was extremely handy for quick grab of breakfast and snacks. We particularly like the close proximity of Takashimaya so the last minute shopping can always fit in. Foods were plentiful at Shinjuku station but we already had something in mind so all we needed to do was to ask the reception staff to book and show us where those restaurants are on the map.
reviews.title: Full Tokyo Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All boxes ticked ... what's not to like ? :)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not just that location is great (shopping centers, night areas, restaurants) but also that the hotel is adjacent to Shinjuku train and metro stations makes life much easier while arriving, departing to/from airport and other cities. This was very important as I was traveling with my parents and walking long distances was out of the question. We also arrived from Kyoto by train and that was very convenient. The Narita airport express train is 8 minutes walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was great and friendly. One of the reception staff (Risa) was specifically extremely helpful and friendly. She spent almost 45 minutes making phone calls to book Kabuki theatre tickets for me and my parents translating and explaining all details.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was OK. There's an Post Office ATM just downstairs (important as in Japan you only can use international ATM cards in post office ATM machines).
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel Century Southern Tower is conveniently located about 5 minutes walk from Shinjuku station which has excellent connections, including getting to/from the airport via the Narita express. We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed the stay. The hotel is quiet, the rooms are clean and adequate in size. Whilst the hotel lacks extensive options for food, in the very close vicinity is a french style cafe, a Starbucks, krispy kreme whilst the ground floor houses a quaint tea room, an Italian restaurant and a Mexican restaurant.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is that the hotel is part of a business complex with the lobby on the 20th floor, taking away from the holiday experience. Also, staff were polite but relatively impersonal.
reviews.title: Very convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was our first stop after arriving in Japan and stayed here for 4 nights. We thought the place was great - easy to get to, great location (especially if you want to do a little shopping), helpful staff, comfortable room, quiet, great views, nice and clean. AND it was so reasonable - coming from New York we expect hotels to cost a fortune, but this was perfectly priced for us. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is my fourth stay at Hotel Century Southern Tower and I have recommended this hotel to many friends. The most recent stay was with my partner and 2 young children (who stayed free as they bed shared) and the kids just loved looking out the window onto Tokyo and the train lines that run beneath the hotel.
reviews.title: Always a memorable stay and would return again and again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is very conveniently located in Shinjuku and just a minutes walk to Takashimaya Times Square (which has an excellent food basement ) and Tokyu Hands. It is also a few minutes walk directly to Shinjuku train station (exit at Southern Tower) and close by are other cafes, francfranc and Kino's at the lower lobby. All of these shops are located on a pedestrian only walkway so there is no traffic to negotiate - great.
reviews.title: Fantastic accessibility, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious and comfortable enough for 2/3 people to share. The room provides all the amenities required and housekeeping are very prompt. The lobby has a very good restaurant and serves an excellent buffet breakfast with ample choice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stay here for the great location to the shops, train station and food outlets. There is a small convenience store located at the lobby which fed my late night snack attacks and need for green tea ice-cream. They also have a microwave at the store for guest use so you can reheat the food purchased at Takashimaya easily.
reviews.title: Good choice for the Tokyo novice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for its location, the size of the beds (from what I saw on TripAdvisor photos), and the views - was VERY satisfied with all these and more.
reviews.title: Professional and convenient - Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The few complaints that we have about this hotel (below) did not in major ways affect our overall rating and experience:
reviews.title: Stunning views from the room, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Bed and pillows were quite hard
reviews.title: convenient, well located, pleasant, great views...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Room temp. was a little difficult to control due to sensitive thermostat
reviews.title: ultra convenient - right across from Tokyo Times Sq and Shinjuku Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the many advantages of staying that this hotel outweigh those complaints:
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Needed a place in Tokyo close to the subway and Shinjuku seemed to be the most central place. Our group had varied interests so must be near shopping and eating.
reviews.title: High floors with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel lived up to its reputation based on prior TripAdvisor reviews. The lobby starts at the 20th floor (1 to 19th are offices, Microsoft Japan, I think), and room floors are from 22 to 35. If you have a choice pick the East facing rooms, you will have a better unblocked view and the neon lights of Shinjuku are to the northeast. One of our group had a west facing room which had another tall building to the northwest which blocked part of the view.
reviews.title: Clean, modern hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception and the breakfast was par for the course and adequate. All the staff we encountered were proficient in English, although we didn't make too many requests for information.
reviews.title: Great location, fantastic view, delightfully comfortable

likes.liked: — Clean, quiet, spacious, dark, temp controls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room size is relatively large for central Tokyo hotels which was also appropriate for the price paid.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shinjuku station is 3 min walk away and really convienient to get to other parts of Tokyo, although being one of the largest subway stations in Tokyo, some navigational skills to get to the correct line is needed, esp during morning and evening peak hours.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel if you want to be in the middle what Tokyo is about

description: Convenient Access - Just three minutes walk from the South exit of Shinjuku Station
